definition: admission ticket
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate

sentences.english: The token entitle you to two free admission to the museum.
sentences.chinese: 憑此券你可以得到兩張參觀博物館的免費入場券。

sentences.english: Passes to spectator stand and beer coupons are offered to bona-fide visitors only.
sentences.chinese: 觀賞區入場券及啤酒暢飲券只供訪港旅客使用。

sentences.english: Eg: a, There were no tickets available for Friday's performance.
sentences.chinese: 星期五演出的入場券搞不到。

sentences.english: For oversea exhibitors, we will send the Admission Ticket by airmail.
sentences.chinese: 主辦單位將會以空郵寄出入場券予海外參展商。

sentences.english: The admission ticket is HK$50 each, students and elderly are entitled to enjoy 50% discount.
sentences.chinese: 入場券每張港幣五十元正，學生和長者半價優惠。

sentences.english: The edges of the admission ticket have been lapped over.
sentences.chinese: 入場券的四邊已經摺起來了。

sentences.english: This ticket will admit two to the opening ceremony of the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 這張展覽會開幕式的入場券可以允許兩人入場。

sentences.english: Fans began lining up early in the morning to buy their cup - tie tickets.
sentences.chinese: 球迷大清早就開始排隊，等着買優勝杯決賽的入場券。

sentences.english: She has left her admission ticket behind.
Please fill in the vice ticket seriously, for the purpose of accepting the award.
sentences.chinese: 入場券副券信息請認真填寫，以免影響兌獎。

sentences.english: We are queuing up to buy tickets for the concert.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在排隊等候買音樂會的入場券。

sentences.english: They are selling tickets like gangbusters.
sentences.chinese: 他們在拼命出售入場券。

sentences.english: There was a rush for the concert tickets.
sentences.chinese: 出現了爭購音樂會入場券的熱潮。

sentences.english: Package ticket: includes tickets for the Bird Nest and Snow Park.
sentences.chinese: 包含鳥巢參觀門票及雪場入場券。

sentences.english: All the tickets were soon distributed.
But with an all-day pass, you can ride all the rides.
sentences.chinese: 但是買一張全天的入場券就可以玩所有的遊樂設施。

definition: competition schedule/the course of a race
to enter the venue for a meeting/to enter into an examination/to enter a stadium, arena etc
integral (calculus)/accumulated points (in sports, at school etc)/total credits earned by student/bonus points in a benefit scheme
preliminary competition/to hold preliminary heats
finals (sports)
popular/hot/in vogue
to compete/to take part in a competition
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
conferences and exhibitions, abbr. of 會議展覽|会议展览[hui4 yi4 zhan3 lan3]
meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
religious procession/exposition
competition (sports etc)/match/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]/to compete
prepared against war/to prepare for war/warmongering
racetrack/field (for athletics competition)
ballsports club (e.g. golf, football etc)
first round (of match, or election)
